metadata.feature_description: Award points for wiki activities like creating articles, commenting, and interactions

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Points display accessible in User Profile

steps.action: Navigate to User Profile page (Activity Feed)
steps.expected: User profile page loads with scoring/points information visible
steps.actual: User profile page loaded successfully showing Points: 37 along with Friends, Following, and Followers counts

observations: Code analysis (Mechanics.cs lines 52-73) shows scoring actions are defined with point values: CreatedArticle (5 rep, 5 exp), EditedArticle (1 rep, 1 exp), CreatedMetaData (1 rep, 1 exp), EditedMetaData (1 rep, 1 exp). Penalty actions include CreatedDeletedArticle (-5 rep) and CreatedFlaggedArticle (-1 rep).
The scoring system is integrated with DNN Social Mechanics via SocialMechanicsController.Instance.LogUserActivity() calls in ContentController.cs and SocialController.cs
Points are displayed in the User Profile section alongside Friends, Following, and Followers statistics
The SuperUser Account has accumulated 37 points from various activities, confirming the scoring system is actively tracking and recording user activities

No separate Reputation display was found - points appear to be the primary metric shown in the UI. The code distinguishes between 'reputation points' and 'experience points' but only 'Points' is displayed in the profile UI

Privilege definitions exist in code (CreateArticles requires 10 points, EditContentUnmoderated requires 100 points, EditMetadata requires 50 points, CreateContentUnmoderated requires 100 points) but no UI for viewing privilege thresholds was found
